TopicTitle: High speed, Low altitude Plane Challenge

Articles.Content:
I got this idea from a thread in general discussion and thought it would make a good challenge.This is my first time suggesting a challenge so I apologize if I went about it wrong. The goal is to establish a low altitude speed record. The rules are as follows:

-Stock parts only

-must be an air breathing engine

-Low altitude being below 2000 meters

Post a screen of your aircraft at top speed and a screen of the end flight mission report.

Current Record: Ekku Zakku 430 m/s in the SenbuRobotto

Edited May 1, 2013 by flyin_ruski
I am currently working on a plane, I'll report soon

Here is my best so far. Almost exceeded my 2000m restriction.

I ended flight shortly after I tried to take off ASAS and do some high speed tricks

Soooo how's it coming bullet?

Edited April 30, 2013 by flyin_ruski
Attempt #1... Didn't make it as fast as your plane
Good work firbos7
Does a drag racer count?

My very minimalist plane, the Senbu (meaning Apex in Japanese):

Simple is good:

I could probably break 400 m/s if I timed my fuel running out to being as close as possible to the 2 km altitude barrier. Also gonna try a smaller fuel tank; less dead weight and less time to get to almost empty XD

Also going to try a version with more engines. I will post my results lol.

EDIT: also I know I haven't posted my flight results screen yet, but that's because I'm trying to do it without going above 2 km. With such a minimalist plane, it's very unstable and will dip and dive a lot, and I've been frequently going above 2 km. I'll post my full submission when I'm happy with my result =3

PS: I have passed 400 m/s at under 2 km with a smaller fuel tank, although it's incredibly unsteady and idk if I could reach max speed without going above 2 km during the flight XD

Edited April 30, 2013 by Ekku Zakku

(Old submission, scroll down for my new one)

Ok, after some adjustments to make it more stable, I reached 403.8 m/s without going above 2 km!

Flight Results:

______________________________________________

New Submission:

Added a 4th engine for a bit more umph without sucking the intake completely dry, and managed 114.1 m/s:

Flight Results:

EDIT: I might or might not have just broken 500 m/s under 2km ASL... Yeah, I'll post that when I have a viable submission XD

EDIT 2: ok yeah, it wasn't with an air-breathing engine so it isn't a viable submission, but 563 m/s while staying under 2km was fun lol.

Edited April 30, 2013 by Ekku Zakku
Not quite the fastest, but 380 is pretty close!

The problem with only using air-breathing engines is that there's a TWR wall that gets hit pretty quickly, I calculated it to be about 183 kN per tonne. If somebody does the math and puts that with the drag at 1999 km ASL, we should find the theoretical maximum.

Outstanding work everyone! Really glad people started participating in this.

Current Record: Ekku Zakku 414m/s

Is Senbu the name of the record holding plane Ekku?

Edited April 30, 2013 by flyin_ruski

Outstanding work everyone! Really glad people started participating in this.

Current Record: Ekku Zakku 414m/s

Is Senbu the name of the record holding plane Ekku?

Yes it is =3 same name and built from the same base plane, just modified a bit.

New submission, this time with an unmanned design. I present, the SenbuRobotto:

Max Speed:

Flight Results:
looks like you will be holding the record for awhile Ekku. I cant seem to break 383m/s

it was a pain to fly, I'd be impressed if somebody does better XD it's hard to pass that wall with air breathing engines though, drop some SRB cans on there and you can go 500 m/s+ lmao. It's all about TWR
Anyone thought about ditching gear?
That's exactly what I did lol, my entry was pure plane, no dead weight.

My first ever challenge submission. A disposable, staging, probe plane,

The Walrus!

It looks scary but it is solid and easy to fly...until staging.

433 M/S

The walrus has a few seconds of fuel after staging, provided by two yellow tanks behind the intake. Stats picture was taken just after running out of fuel. It 'lands' via the impact method.

I think that manned and unmanned craft should be separate categories for scoring, because the manned pods weigh more.
Omg, I never thought to use fuel from those tiny probe tanks! XD time for me to try again!

just got to 440 m/s!

yes, i know i forgot to ditch the oxidizer in the droptanks, but the drop anyway so it doesnt matter.

i originally made it for m1sz fastest under 1km challenge, but it couldnt land, and was 5 m/s slower than the current record holder.

i got soooooooo close to 2km (1998m), but never went over:D

anyway, for the record, dussel V:
